subject: Data
title: Edgar Codd and the Relational Model
description: One-minute skill: Edgar Codd and the Relational Model.

hook.text: In 1970, an IBM researcher published a paper so revolutionary that his own employer tried to suppress it.

buildup.text: Edgar Codd proposed organizing data into tables with rows and columns, linked by shared key values.

discovery.text: The relational model meant data could be queried flexibly â€” you didn't need to know how it was stored on disk.

twist.text: IBM resisted because they were selling hierarchical databases. Codd's model made their product obsolete.

climax.text: The relational model became the foundation of virtually every database built for the next 40 years.

punchline.text: One paper overthrew an entire industry. IBM had to follow its own researcher.

quiz.question: Why did IBM initially resist Edgar Codd's relational model?
options: It would make their existing hierarchical database products obsolete
